intro: Erigeron ocoensis, commonly known as the Ocoee fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and forest edges. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms with pale yellow to white flowers from late spring to early summer. Erigeron ocoensis is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
